verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> the Lord<WH3068>, and said<WH559>,
I know<WH3045> that you can do<WH3201> every thing<WH4209>, and that no thought can be withheld from you<WH1219>.
Who is he that hides<WH5956> counsel<WH6098> outside knowledge<WH1847>? therefore have I uttered<WH5046> that I understood<WH995> not<WH6381>; things too wonderful for me<WH3045>, which I knew not.
Hear<WH8085>, I beg you<WH1696>, and I will speak: I will demand<WH7592> of you<WH3045>, and declare you unto me.
I have heard<WH8085> of you by the hearing<WH8088> of the ear<WH241>: but now my eye<WH5869> sees you<WH7200>.
Therefore I abhor<WH3988> myself<WH5162>, and repent in dust<WH6083> and ashes<WH665>.

And it was so<WH310>, that after the Lord<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> these words<WH1697> unto Job<WH347>, the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489>, My wrath<WH639> is kindled<WH2734> against you<WH8147>, and against your two friends<WH7453>: for you have not spoken<WH1696> of me the thing that is right<WH3559>, as my servant<WH5650> Job has<WH347>.

Therefore take<WH3947> unto you now seven<WH7651> bullocks<WH6499> and seven<WH7651> rams<WH352>, and go<WH3212> to my servant<WH5650> Job<WH347>, and offer up<WH5927> for yourselves a burnt offering<WH5930>; and my servant<WH5650> Job<WH347> shall pray<WH6419> for you<WH6440>: for him will I accept<WH5375>: lest I deal<WH6213> with you after your wickedness<WH5039>, in that you have not spoken<WH1696> of me the thing which is right<WH3559>, like my servant<WH5650> Job<WH347>.

So Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> and Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite<WH7747> and Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284> went<WH3212>, and did<WH6213> according as the Lord<WH3068> commanded<WH1696> them<WH3068>: the Lord also accepted<WH5375> Job<WH6440>.

And the Lord<WH3068> turned<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Job<WH347>, when he prayed<WH6419> for his friends<WH7453>: also the Lord<WH3068> gave<WH3254> Job<WH347> twice as much as he had before<WH4932>.

Then came<WH935> there unto him all his brothers<WH251>, and all his sisters<WH269>, and all they that had been of his acquaintance<WH3045> before<WH6440>, and did eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with him in his house<WH1004>: and they bemoaned<WH5110> him<WH5162>, and comforted him over all the evil<WH7451> that the Lord<WH3068> had brought<WH935> upon him<WH376>: every man also gave<WH5414> him a<WH259> piece of money<WH7192>, and every one<WH376> an earring<WH5141> of gold<WH2091>.

So the Lord<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> the latter end<WH319> of Job<WH347> more than his beginning<WH7225>: for he had fourteen<WH702> thousand<WH505> sheep<WH6629>, and six<WH8337> thousand<WH505> camels<WH1581>, and a thousand<WH505> yoke<WH6776> of oxen<WH1241>, and a thousand<WH505> she donkeys<WH860>.
He had also seven<WH7658> sons<WH1121> and three<WH7969> daughters<WH1323>.

And he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the first<WH259>, Jemima<WH3224>; and the name<WH8034> of the second<WH8145>, Kezia<WH7103>; and the name<WH8034> of the third<WH7992>, Keren<WH7163>â€“happuch.

And in all the land<WH776> were no women<WH802> found<WH4672> so fair<WH3303> as the daughters<WH1323> of Job<WH347>: and their father<WH1> gave<WH5414> them inheritance<WH5159> among<WH8432> their brothers<WH251>.

After<WH310> this lived<WH2421> Job<WH347> a hundred<WH3967> and forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, and saw<WH7200> his sons<WH1121>, and his sons<WH1121>' sons<WH1121>, even four<WH702> generations<WH1755>.
So Job<WH347> died<WH4191>, being old<WH2205> and full<WH7649> of days<WH3117>.
